snippet: Reynaldo Cuevas, who was killed by a police bullet, was working at his uncle’s bodega with myriad aspirations to move forward with his life.
abstract: Family of Reynaldo Cuevas, 20-year-old bodega worker killed by a police bullet as he tried to flee armed robbers, says he was working hard to improve his life after the 2010 murder of his father in the Dominican Republic; says the young Cuevas hoped to bring his 3-year-old daughter to New York and was making serious plans for a college education and career.

byline.original: By WINNIE HU and NATE SCHWEBER

lead_paragraph: Reynaldo Cuevas, who was killed by a police bullet, was working at his uncle’s bodega with myriad aspirations to move forward with his life.

headline.seo: Man Fatally Shot by Police Grew Up in Bronx Bodegas
headline.main: A 20-Year-Old Father’s Goal Was to Make His Slain Father Proud
headline.print_headline: A 20-Year-Old Father’s Goal Was to Make His Slain Father Proud
